learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate advanced communication skills in the language at B2.1 level.
Exhibit a proficient level of Spanish language grammar appropriate to B2.1 in writings, reviews, reflections and discussions.
Comprehend texts (written and visual) and authentic real-world sources material in Spanish at B2.1 level.

Engage in independent and collaborative spoken interaction in Spanish at B2.1 level, demonstrating fluency, clarity and responsiveness across a range of tasks, including delivering a structured group presentation on a complex topic, responding to audience questions, and participating in debate.
Identify and appreciate the different aspects that compose the culture, history and society of the Spanish speaking world and their connection to other cultures.

WEEK 4 - Tarea 1 - 20/03/2026 5:00 pm

WEEK 6 - Tarea 2 - 2/04/2026 5:00 pm

WEEK 11 - Tarea 3 - 15/05/2026 5:00 pm

WEEK 13 - Tarea 4 - 29/05/2026 5:00 pm

Submit by 5pm via Blackboard.
assessments.task_description:
The completion of the exercises at the end of each chapter will assist in the consolidation of the teaching material learnt in class and will facilitate the progressive nature of learning a language. This assessment puts into practice the language learning skills of listening, comprehension, reading and writing. Therefore, it allows you to demonstrate competency at low B2 level on the CEFR language proficiency scale for Understanding (Listening and reading) and Writing. Students will also be able to identify any area that needs attention and find adequate help from lecturers in class and during consultation hours.

Each task consists of listening to audio material accompanying Aula Internacional Plus 4 B2.1 (audiofiles available in Campus Difusion) and 1-2 composition based on the content of each Unidad or an assigned film (Diarios de motocicleta, Nosotros los Nobles, El laberinto de fauno or La contadora de cuentos).

Students are required to use their own words when answering the questions (do not transcribe). The composition must include the relevant grammatical concepts studied in each Unidad. Please ensure that the worksheets are submitted through Blackboard Turnitin by 5pm pm on the specified due dates. E-mail attachments ARE NOT ACCEPTED.

Maximum mark is 5% for each Tarea, accruing a total of 20%.

El completar los ejercicios al final de cada unidad te ayudará a consolidar los puntos gramaticales que hemos estudiado en clase y a identificar áreas que necesitan mayor atención y ulteriores consultas con tu profesora. Esta preparación te será de utilidad para las pruebas y el examen.

STATEMENT ON AI & MT

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Turnitin (Blackboard Tab: Evaluaciones) by 5pm on or before the due date.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
60-minute written assessment task on the grammar and vocabulary studied in class: Unidades 1, 2 and 3 of Aula Internacional Plus 4.

This assessment item allows you to demonstrate competency at low B2 level on the CEFR language proficiency scale for Understanding and Writing.

Prueba escrita en la que se valorará el uso de la gramática y del vocabulario estudiados en la clase. Unidades 1, 2 y 3 de Aula Internacional Plus 4.

STATEMENT ON AI & MT

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.submission_guidelines: This assessment task will be available for completion via Blackboard. The link will be available in the Evaluaciones Menu Tab.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Students will deliver a presentation to the class as if they were Cultural Mediators. They will present on the work of an artist of the Spanish speaking world. They should inform their lecturer about their selection by Week 8. No other group can select the same artist.

  • Students are required to work in groups of three. However, assessment is individually marked (see Criteria & Marking). They should contact their lecturer if the group is not functioning effectively.
  • Each student will present a 5-minute talk (15 minutes per group, plus questions). Reading is NOT allowed. Students can use PowerPoint and one flashcard only to help advance their presentation (see Criteria & Marking in Blackboard).
  • Students should incorporate in their discourse the grammatical construction studied in the course (Check Unidades 1-6 in Aula Internacional Plus 4, especially ‘organizadores de la argumentación’ and ‘conectores’: Unidad 2 and 4).
  • If a group member requests an extension for whatever reason, the extension will be valid for the group member and not the whole group. Assessment for the oral presentation is individually marked.

The presentation should cover:

1 THEMES- Each student will present one piece of work by the artist selected. These 3 basic questions should be addressed in each presentation: What is going on in this picture/piece? What do you see/hear/feel that makes you say that? What more can we find? The presentation should include an analysis of the artwork. For example, the presentation may cover its importance, its national or global context, the story/history behind the artwork, its style, information on the artist that is relevant to the analysed work. Students should connect the artwork to themes such as history, social issues, ideologies, paradigms.

2 ORGANISATION- Use PowerPoint. An important part of the presentation is the interaction with the public. The lecturer and students will be asking questions at the end of each group presentation. Students should also prepare questions for the audience (since they are presenting as cultural mediators) to ask during the presentation.

This assessment item allows you to demonstrate competency at low B2 level on the CEFR language proficiency scale for Understanding and Speaking. You will also develop skills and attributes of collaborative team work.

STATEMENT ON AI & MT

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted in the oral venue. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct. You may however find it useful to use these tools to plan and practice for your oral presentation.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Each student will present a 5-minute talk role playing as cultural mediator (15 minutes per group, plus questions). Reading is NOT allowed. Students can use one flashcard only to help advance their presentation (see Criteria & Marking on Blackboard).
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
This is a written task on the grammar and vocabulary studied ion classes: Unidades 4, 5 and 6 of Aula internacional Plus 4. The task is 60-minutes with 10 minutes perusal. During planning time students are encouraged to review and plan responses to the exam questions. The exam is completed in person on a set date during the End of Semester Exam Period. This is a handwritten exam.This assessment item allows you to demonstrate competency at low B2 level on the CEFR language proficiency scale for Understanding and Writing.

STATEMENT ON AI & MT

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Please answer the questions in the spaces provided on the exam paper.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.
